benchmark_details.name: FinAR-Bench (Financial Analysis and Reasoning Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: FinAR-Bench is a task-oriented benchmark dataset for evaluating LLMs in financial fundamental analysis, specifically focusing on financial statement analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs' capabilities in financial statement analysis as part of fundamental analysis in finance.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: LLMs demonstrate limitations in performing precise and reliable financial analysis, particularly with inherent computational inaccuracies.

data.source: Financial statement data of 100 companies from the Shanghai Stock Exchange, collected in XBRL and PDF formats.
data.annotation: Automatically generated from XBRL data; manual extraction for PDF.

methods: Evaluation of LLM responses using RMS metric
Tournament-style evaluation using LLM as judge for logical reasoning task
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the structure and accuracy of generated outputs compared to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision and recall indicate a model's better accuracy in performing financial statement analysis tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Various LLMs were assessed with performance varying across tasks, highlighting differences in capabilities.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures involve systematic comparisons of generated outputs against expected results.
